channel.title: machine learning on Scott Jeen
channel.description: Recent content in machine learning on Scott Jeen

item.title: Taking a peek inside black-box function approximators
item.description: Abstract In this talk, I will introduce deterministic and probabilistic black-box function approximators, with applications for timeseries modelling. First, I introduce the multilayer perceptron (neural network), demonstrating how they can model arbitrarily complex functions, but highlighting their propensity to overfit the training data. Second, I introduce the Gaussian process (GP), a bayesian, probabilistic approach to function approximation. I visualise how GP’s quantify uncertainty, a robust trait in the context of control, but highlight their inability to scale to large datasets.

item.title: Can probabilistic machine learning help limit climate change?
item.description: üåç If we are to successfully mitigate climate change we must reduce global emissions to near-zero by 2050. To this end, three solutions exist: Generate energy using emission-free technologies; Capture and bury emissions using carbon capture and storage (CCS); and Use energy more efficiently. In the UK, emission reduction efforts via solution 1) have so far proven extremely successful. Emission-free energy technologies generated 45% of UK electricity demand in 2020 which has caused a decrease in grid carbon intensity of 66%.
